title: EU’s New Defense Plan Aims to Boost European Military Purchases
description: The European Union will aim to make as much as half of its defense system purchases within the bloc by 2035, reversing a trend of buying a majority of its military equipment from third countries.

title: Biden Hopes Gaza Cease-Fire Starts as Soon as Next Monday
description: President Joe Biden expressed hope negotiators would secure a temporary pause in the fighting between Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip, describing the talks as “close” and saying that a cease-fire could start as soon as next Monday.

title: Trump’s Favorability Rating Reaches the Highest Since 2022
description: The average favorable rating for Donald Trump hit its highest level since before the 2022 midterm elections, as the former president marches toward a likely November rematch against a less popular Joe Biden.

title: Social Media Case Tests ‘Editorial Discretion’ Versus Censorship
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs correspondent Emily Birnbaum recaps today’s Supreme Court arguments on social media. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Senegal’s Sall Moots Amnesty Law That May Free Opposition Leader Sonko
description: Senegalese President Macky Sall will request lawmakers to consider passing an amnesty bill, a measure that may potentially lead to the release of the country’s main opposition leader Ousmane Sonko, who’s been in detention for the past seven months for fueling deadly protests.

title: Facebook, YouTube to Face New Canada Rules on ‘Harmful’ Content
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government introduced an online safety law in Canada, joining European countries in trying to compel internet companies to actively regulate and remove harmful content.

title: Poland’s Sikorski Says EU Should Go Back to Pre-War Rules of Food Trade With Ukraine
description: Poland’s Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said the European Union should restore trade restriction on Ukrainian food imports that existed before Russia’s invasion to avoid the erosion of support for the war-ravaged country.

title: What to Know About a Possible Government Shutdown Looming Over Congress
description: The US government is fast approaching yet another shutdown unless Congress approves new funding by looming deadlines on March 1 and March 8. With the Democratic-led Senate and Republican-led House still far apart on the measures, another temporary funding patch or a shutdown are becoming more likely. Memories remain fresh of the longest shutdown in US history, lasting 35 days in late 2018 into early 2019, over President Donald Trump’s insistence on adding $5.7 billion to the budget for a wall on

title: US Defense Chief Austin Had No ‘Ill Intent’ in Hospital Confusion, Pentagon Finds
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and his team never acted with bad intentions when he failed to immediately disclose his hospitalization over complications from prostate-cancer surgery, according to a Pentagon review of the episode.

title: California’s Gavin Newsom Faces New Recall Threat From Old Critics
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom faces a new recall effort from some of the same organizers who tried and failed to unseat him in 2021.

title: White House Decries Trump’s Claim That His Charges Increase Black Voter Support
description: The White House denounced Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump’s assertion that his criminal indictments have increased his support among Black voters.

title: Italy Reached Out to China’s BYD in Search of Another Carmaker
description: BYD Co. has been contacted by the Italian government as part of the country’s efforts to attract a second car manufacturer beyond Fiat maker Stellantis NV.

title: United Steelworkers Union Signs NDA With Nippon Steel to Advance Talks
description: Nippon Steel Corp. and the United Steelworkers have signed a non-disclosure agreement, allowing talks to progress even as the union publicly maintains its opposition to the Japanese company’s planned $14.1 billion takeover of United States Steel Corp.

title: Supreme Court Fears ‘Landmines’ in Social Media Debate Over Free Speech
description: The US Supreme Court struggled to find a middle ground on the application of free-speech principles to the internet, as the justices reviewed Republican-backed laws that would sharply restrict the editorial discretion of the largest social media companies.

title: Italy Approves €6.3B Decree for Green and Tech Transition
description: Giorgia Meloni, Italy's prime minister, during the Italy Africa summit in Rome, Italy, on Monday, Jan. 29, 2024. Meloni unveiled an investment plan worth more than 5.5 billion ($5.9 billion) to strengthen Italian relations with Africa, in an attempt to boost energy ties and curb migration flows. Photographer: Alessia Pierdomenico/Bloomberg

title: Global Money Chiefs Try to Keep Wars Off Table at Divided G-20
description: The world’s top economic policymakers figure they’ll have to steer clear of two conflicts convulsing global politics — the wars in Ukraine and Gaza — to make progress on anything else at this week’s G-20 summit in Brazil.

title: Scholz Closes Door on Sending Long-Range Missiles to Ukraine
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz ruled out sending long-range Taurus missiles to Ukraine, arguing that supplying them would mean Germany becomes a party to the war against Russia.

title: Hungary Elects Sulyok as President After Sex-Abuse Scandal Ousts Predecessor
description: Hungarian lawmakers elected the chief of the nation’s constitutional court to be the next president after a child-abuse scandal toppled the head of state this month and threatened to sap support for long-time Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

title: Advanced Chip Firms Want $70 Billion From US, Raimondo Says
description: Advanced semiconductor companies have requested more than double the amount of available federal funds for projects in the US, Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said, referring to a program designed to bring chip manufacturing back to American soil.

title: Iran Production of Near Bomb-Grade Uranium Falls for First Time
description: Iran reduced its stockpile of near bomb-grade uranium over the past three months, a move that could ease some fear over a wider Middle East conflict as Tehran’s allies trade fire with US forces.

title: EU Looks at Weapons Purchases Outside Bloc to Restock Ukraine
description: European leaders meeting in Paris will discuss a proposal to buy ammunition from countries outside the region, giving momentum to an idea that would help get much-needed military equipment to Ukraine.

title: Commons Speaker Rejects Call for Gaza Vote, Setting Up SNP Clash
description: House of Commons Speaker Lindsay Hoyle rejected a Scottish National Party call for a fresh vote on a cease-fire in Gaza, risking further tensions with the chamber’s third-biggest party following chaotic scenes in Parliament last week.

title: Majority of Voters Support Building a Wall Along US-Mexico Border
description: A majority of Americans support building a wall along the US-Mexico border for the first time since Donald Trump popularized the idea during his 2016 presidential bid, according to a Monmouth University poll.

title: How Russia Pushed Finland and Sweden to Join NATO
description: Despite their orientation toward the US and western Europe, Finland and Sweden since the Cold War had bet that their national security was best protected by staying out of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. They aimed to avoid disturbing the military balance in the Baltic Sea region and provoking Russia. Those reservations were cast aside following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, which spurred the two Nordic countries to join the alliance in readiness for whatever President Vladimir Putin may

title: Sweden Clears Final Hurdle to Join NATO With Hungary Vote
description: Sweden cleared the final obstacle to gaining NATO membership in a move that will solidify the alliance’s grip over Northern Europe and the Baltic region.

title: Trump Appeals New York’s $454 Million Fraud Verdict Against Him
description: Former President Donald Trump filed notice that he was appealing New York state’s $454 million civil fraud verdict over his asset valuations, kicking off a fight that could drag out the case for months or longer.

title: Biden, Trump to Make Dueling Visits to US-Mexico Border
description: President Joe Biden and Republican frontrunner Donald Trump will each visit the US-Mexico border in Texas on Thursday, setting up a showdown over a defining issue for the 2024 election.

title: Russia Buys Tens of Millions of Euros of Banned EU Weapons Tech
description: European Union states still aren’t doing enough to stop Russia getting hold of sanctioned technologies for use in weapons to wage war on Ukraine, according to officials familiar with the matter.

title: US Used AI to Help Find Middle East Targets for Airstrikes
description: The US used artificial intelligence to identify targets hit by air strikes in the Middle East this month, a defense official said, revealing growing military use of the technology for combat.

title: Navalny Was Set for Release in Swap When He Died, Aide Says
description: Alexey Navalny had been close to release in a prisoner exchange with the US and Germany shortly before his death in an Arctic prison, a top aide to the Russian opposition leader said.

title: Ukraine Says It Got Only Third of Artillery Shells Pledged by EU
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the European Union has so far only delivered about a third of the artillery ammunition the bloc pledged for his country.

title: Bolivia’s Socialist Rulers Mend Ties With Capitalists in a Nation on the Brink
Burundi Says Nine Die in Attack by Rwanda-Based RED-Tabara Group
description: Burundi’s government said a Rwanda-based group staged an attack on its territory on Sunday night, killing nine people, including six women and an army officer.

title: Houthis Boost Military Power for Red Sea Battle With US
description: It has been almost seven weeks since the US and UK began conducting airstrikes against Houthi militants in Yemen to stem their months-long attacks on ships in the Red Sea, a vital waterway for global commerce. But the Iran-backed militants, who control a sizeable area of north-west Yemen, are far from deterred.

title: Hungary’s Orban Asks Parliament to Support Sweden’s NATO Bid
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban asked parliament to ratify Sweden’s accession to the NATO military alliance, arguing that the Nordic country’s integration will bolster Hungary’s security.

title: Political Heat: Why Rhetoric from MPs Matters
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Ronna McDaniel to Vacate RNC Chair in March After Pressure From Trump
description: Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel is leaving the party’s top leadership role after weeks of pressure from former President Donald Trump.

title: Guinea Labor Unions Strike Over Internet and Radio Restrictions
description: Guinea labor unions started an indefinite strike Monday to demand an end to internet and radio restrictions.

title: US Chamber Chief Visits China in Sign of Warming Business Ties
description: The head of US Chamber of Commerce is visiting China this week to meet with American businesses and Chinese officials, according to people familiar with the matter, the latest sign of improving ties between the world’s two biggest economies.

title: Lula Pulls Off Rare Trick Twice, Wooing Wall Street and the Poor
description: In his first spell as Brazil’s president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva managed to keep both low-income voters and Wall Street investors happy. In his first year back in power, he has pulled off the same rare trick.

title: Sweden’s NATO Bid Enters the Home Straight
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Sunak Tries to Quell Islamophobia Row After MP Suspended
description: Rishi Sunak is struggling to contain a row over Islamophobia in his Conservative Party after its former deputy chairman was suspended for claiming Labour’s Mayor of London Sadiq Khan is controlled by “Islamists.”

title: Why Online Free Speech Is Now Up to the Supreme Court
description: Conspiracy theories, election lies and Covid misinformation before the 2020 US presidential election led social media companies to implement rules policing online speech and suspending some users — including former President Donald Trump. That practice, known as “content moderation,” will be put to the test after two Republican-led states, Florida and Texas, passed laws in 2021 to stop what they believed were policies censoring conservatives. The fate of those social media laws now rests with th

title: Billionaire GOP Donors Pivot to Congress After Haley's Run Fades
description: First Wall Street considered Ron DeSantis. Then it went for Nikki Haley.

title: WTO Chief Sees Trade Missing Forecasts on Growth Headwinds
description: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, director-general of the World Trade Organization (WTO), during a panel session on the closing day of the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, on Friday, Jan. 19, 2024. The annual Davos gathering of political leaders, top executives and celebrities runs from January 15 to 19.

title: China Quietly Scrubs Ousted Defense Minister Li From Website
description: China has removed Li Shangfu’s name from the Defense Ministry’s official website, the latest sign that the former defense minister who was unexpectedly removed from his post late last year is in trouble.

title: Zambia Bonds Jump as Revamp Gets Traction With China, India Deal
description: Zambia’s dollar debt jumped after its government said over the weekend that China and India, the last two nations needed to sign a deal to restructure Zambia’s debt, have done so.

title: Denmark Drops Nord Stream Blast Probe Without Criminal Case
description: Denmark gave up on an investigation into the explosions that in 2022 ruptured the Nord Stream natural gas pipelines just outside its territorial waters, following a similar decision in neighboring Sweden earlier this month.

title: Farmers Flank EU Headquarters as Agriculture Ministers Meet
description: Farmers honked tractor horns Monday and tried to break through police barriers as they surrounded the main European Union offices in Brussels and demanded more support from the bloc.

title: Palestinian PM Shtayyeh Resigns Amid Calls for Reform
description: The prime minister of the Palestinian Authority, Mohammad Shtayyeh, tendered his resignation amid a broad push by Arab states and the US for the governing agency to reform itself.

title: Russia Will Hit Back If Foreign Assets Seized, Siluanov Warns
description: Russia will give a “symmetrical” response to any actions by the US and its allies that target its frozen assets abroad, Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said.

title: Seoul to Step Up Support for Single People With Cheaper Co-Living Units
description: The Seoul government will provide more affordable rental housing for single people in the form of co-living spaces, as the number of solo households in South Korea rapidly increases.

title: Polish Diplomat’s Big Mouth Strikes Again and Lands a Blow on Russia
description: Radoslaw Sikorski’s tendency to speak his mind often lands him in trouble.

title: Hong Kong Security Law May Hurt News Reporting, Press Group Says
description: A Hong Kong journalist group has raised concerns about a planned new security law, saying a broad definition of offenses could hurt journalists’ ability to report in the Asian financial hub.

title: Malaysia’s King Warns Against Threatening Stability Under Anwar
description: Malaysia’s King Sultan Ibrahim Iskandar said he would not entertain any request that may undermine the country’s political stability, in a boost to Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s administration.

title: South Korea Gives Trainee Doctors Four Days to End Walkout
description: South Korea called on about 9,000 trainee doctors who have walked off the job to return to work by Thursday without facing reprisals, trying to end a protest that has led to canceled surgeries and patients being turned away from emergency rooms.

title: New Tuvalu PM Feleti Teo Named as Taiwan, China Relations Hang in the Balance
description: Feleti Teo has been elected unopposed as the next prime minister of the small Pacific nation of Tuvalu, a decision which may have implications for one of Taiwan’s remaining diplomatic allies in the region.

title: Gaza Row to Dominate British Politics Again Ahead of By-Election
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Labour leader Keir Starmer are seeking to steer British politics back to domestic affairs ahead of a by-election this week and tone down political conflict over the Israel-Hamas war.
